pullRequest.body:
Since this bump does not include https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/427 (in order to avoid having to handle the intermediate commits all at once), we temporarily remove the single use of a `∀ i ∉ s,` binder, and the two tests of it.

We can revert these changes in a later Std bump, once we've address the other awkward bumps inbetween.

This unblocks #8711.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: That seems ready to go. :smile:
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7144996421/job/19459751183)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7144996421/job/19459751978)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7144996421/job/19459751382)
Note this broke several new uses of `∃ a ∉ s,` in #8892 that should therefore be fixed too when we gain back the nice binders. Look for `∃ a, a ∉ s ∧` to find them.

> Note this broke several new uses of `∃ a ∉ s,` in #8892 that should therefore be fixed too when we gain back the nice binders. Look for `∃ a, a ∉ s ∧` to find them.

I've fixed these again in #8888.
https://github.com/leanprover/std4/compare/baf6defee1fe881ae535519c0776f37f6ef08603...b88aedb3f61a0dff32c2edc12dc8fcdde8dfdd40

I am afraid this update will break due to https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/425/commits/0e24b03192c81c74c1b3d8a81ca5330f8ec9f32e which was reverted in https://github.com/leanprover/std4/pull/427.
@eric-wieser fixed this issue.
Great. That should work.
Unfortunately, there may be further issues in the documentation build.
Thank you for fixing these! Let's hope those go through.
I think it's probably not the end of the world if the doc build stop working for a day or two while we work through the Std backlog; we've had them fail at various points in the past.
@eric-wieser fixed this issue.

https://github.com/leanprover/std4/compare/baf6defee1fe881ae535519c0776f37f6ef08603...ddcb08633f442f1af91cad299d6ed114434b54b2

(I bumped forward one more commit, since it seems nothing new broke)
That's great.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: bump std

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore: update std4 to b197bd2, catching up to leanprover/std4#427
